verses.roman:
kalau kākiṇike 'py arthe
vigṛhya tyakta-sauhṛdāḥ
tyakṣyanti ca priyān prāṇān
haniṣyanti svakān api

synonyms: kalau—in the age of Kali; kākiṇike—of a small coin; api—even; arthe—for the sake; vigṛhya—developing enmity; tyakta—abandoning; sauhṛdāḥ—friendly relations; tyakṣyanti—they will reject; ca—and; priyān—dear; prāṇān—their own lives; haniṣyanti—they will kill; svakān—their own relatives; api—even.
translation: In Kali-yuga men will develop hatred for each other even over a few coins. Giving up all friendly relations, they will be ready to lose their own lives and kill even their own relatives.
